meanings.sent1: She gave him a reproachingly look when he broke her favorite mug.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's reproachingly tone made the students realize they had misbehaved.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked at the knocked-over vase reproachingly, as if asking who did it.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds hung reproachingly over the city, warning of an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: Her reproachingly expression spoke volumes about her feelings towards his actions.

meanings.definition: In a manner that conveys blame or criticism.
meanings.sent1: She shook her head reproachingly at his tardiness.
meanings.sent2: He spoke reproachingly to his brother for eating the last cookie.
meanings.sent3: The dog wagged its tail reproachingly after being scolded for digging in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The old house creaked reproachingly as if holding secrets of the past.
meanings.sent5: The wind howled reproachingly through the empty streets, echoing the loneliness of the night.
